explains: n. 干部会议；核心会议；党团会议
vi. 召开干部会议；开核心会议

sentences.en: Our caucus meetings were always the highlight of my week.
sentences.cn: 我们的国会会议总是我一周中最显要的部分。

sentences.en: If Kyl agrees, the majority of the caucus will follow suit.
sentences.cn: 假如凯尔同意，核心会议的多数人会随声附和。

sentences.en: But that is not what the conservative caucus-goers want to hear.
sentences.cn: 但是那并不是保守派党团成员希望听到的。
